page.title: 18Transport-Waterways/Railways
page.content: We collected our information on Wednesday 15th May 1985.We first saw the Coventry to Fazeley canal. The first boat we saw was called the 'Warwick Navigator'. We walked on down the muddy towpath. The longboat followed us. It was blue and had a life savers ring. We passed the Tamworth Cruising Club Marina.Many boats were out of the water under repair. Some of us then went to the railway.There were two goods trains carrying coal and one passenger train in half an hour. The railway travels from Birmingham to Derby and the north. We sat beside the River Tame. There were no boats because the river was too shallow. The river is only slightly polluted now. On the way back we saw a water vole in the canal and we picked some wild flowers.
